results.title: ‘Guillermo del Toro’s Pinocchio’ Review: Puppets and Power
results.abstract: This quirky classic has been made all the stranger by the decision to turn it into an ill-conceived metaphor about fascism.

multimedia.caption: Pinocchio (voiced by Gregory Mann) and Count Volpe (voiced by Christoph Waltz). Nothing makes the wooden puppet more wholly, recognizably human than his disobedience and repeated mistakes.

results.title: A Trans Icon of the 20th Century Revived by Trans Stars of the 21st Century

results.title: For Emma Corrin, Identity Is an Ever-Evolving Project
results.abstract: Onscreen and off, the nonbinary star of “Lady Chatterley’s Lover” and “The Crown” has been exploring gender and the cost and responsibility of being heard.

results.title: Julia Reichert, Documentarian of the Working Class, Dies at 76
